alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:08PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lawrence, northwestern Mingo and southeastern Wayne Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 208 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Charley, or 9 miles southeast of Blaine, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ulysses, Charley, Kermit, Gallup, Wilsondale, Crum, Clifford, Glenhayes, Lenore, Breeden and Naugatuck. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
